data.title: setup.py doesn't check ndk_root correctly on windows
data.body:
There is only sdk/ndk-bundle/ndk-build.cmd on windows platform when I download the NDK from the  The Android Studio 2.12. When running setup.py,cocos2d-x-3.11.1 only check for "ndk-build".

The correct code should be like this:

```
        ndk_build_path = os.path.join(ndk_root, 'ndk-build')
        if os.path.isfile(ndk_build_path) or os.path.isfile(os.path.join(ndk_root, 'ndk-build.cmd')):
            return True
        else:
            return False
```

data.title: Bunnymark Test between Cocos2d-x and Unity
data.body:
Hi, there.

https://github.com/eray-z/Game-Engine-Benchmarks

My test results for 60fps; (Device: Iphone 4s) 
Unity v5.3.5f1 : max 800 bunnies 
Cocos2d-x v3.10 : max 1800 bunnies

The results are looking good. (But unity isn't the same segment with cocos2d-x) But cocos2d-x bunnymark results isn't better then libgdx, haxeflixel...vs. I think, it must be better. Cocos2d-x is c++ based engine, it has great framework struct. How cocos2d-x can't get better render performance then java or haxe based game engines?

Thanks

data.title: Avoid shadow warning when building with Xcode 7.3
data.body:
Hello, this PR avoids the following `-Wshadow` warning when compiling AssetsManagerEx with Xcode 7.3:

```
extensions/assets-manager/AssetsManagerEx.cpp:667:20: declaration shadows a local variable [-Wshadow]

        AsyncData* asyncData = (AsyncData*)param;
                      ^
```

So far this is the last patch for fixing minor compiler warnings in `libcocos2d Mac` (except those caused by third party libraries or bindings). :tada:

Thanks for the great work on cocos2d-x!

data.title: Serious Memory Leak in CCLabel
data.body:
now we found a serious memory leak in CCLabel. if we create a cocos2d::Label, it will create two custom listeners: _purgeTextureListener && _resetTextureListener. and the two listener will always in memory, it will cause serious memory leak when we create many labels. @minggo pls help us.
now.  and it is very easy to reproduce this problem.

data.title: [ci skip]not use capital letters by default
app maybe hang when i use simulator on mac
data.body:
the simulator maybe hang when i use it on mac platform.
when i output a large log, the simulator hang.
I checked the code and found that simulator use NSPipe to redirect log to textview.but, the readend and writeend of pipe in the same thread.

Think about it.  What does NSFileHandle do when it has read some data in the background?  It queues up a message for the main thread (or whatever thread you did the -readInBackgroundAndNotify from) to handle the data. 

Now, what is your main thread doing?  Well, it's writing to stdout.  It is definitely not prepared to handle the notification from NSFileHandle -- that is, it's not sitting idle in the run loop.  So, it has ceased asking NSFileHandle to read from the pipe.  So, eventually, the script is going to fill whatever buffer there is.

the following is my suggestion and solution:
Maybe, we should arrange to execute the two things on independent threads of execution, or even processes.  That's the only way to avoid the problem.

that is my code and it works well:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13765798/15804430/4e46b572-2b3a-11e6-93c0-22dd5464ea5f.png)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13765798/15804438/806ab09e-2b3a-11e6-9505-54919bdaf40e.png)

data.title: Android project.properties file may have typo
data.body:
In the templates for the android `project.properties` files, I think the comments may contain an incorrect statement. It says:

```
# This file is automatically generated by Android Tools.
# Do not modify this file -- YOUR CHANGES WILL BE ERASED!
#
# This file must be checked in Version Control Systems.
```

I'm guessing this was meant to have the same comment as in `local.properties`:

```
# This file must *NOT* be checked into Version Control Systems,
# as it contains information specific to your local configuration.
```

I'll gladly make a pull request if someone can verify that this is a mistake.

Example file:
`cocos2d-x/templates/cpp-template-default/proj.android-studio/app/project.properties`

It also looks like `project.properties` is included in the `.gitignore` file, but is still being tracked by git. I'm guessing this file should not be tracked?

data.title: Fix unused parameter warning when compiling CCArray
data.body:
This patch fixes the following warning when compiling `__Array` class with GCC 5.2.1 on Ubuntu 15.10:

```
cocos/deprecated/CCArray.cpp:695:69: warning: unused parameter releaseObject [-Wunused-parameter]
 void __Array::replaceObjectAtIndex(ssize_t index, Ref* object, bool releaseObject/* = true*/)
                                                                     ^
```

Thanks!

data.title: libwebsocket would crash after Ipv6 update
data.body:
# Env: VS2015, Windows7.1

After update the libwebsocket lib for IPv6, program would crash when initialize websocket (lws_create_context). I think the reason is that websockets.lib is compiled by VS2013. Through VS2015 can link the lib, but the VS2015 and 2013 use different CRT may cause crash.
I use VS2015 compile libwebsocket.lib to work around this issue. Maybe it would be better if we can change libwebsocket to dll.
Thanks!  
Dai

data.title: avoid to access invalid memory
data.body: When received data size is 1024, then `buf[readBytes] = '\0';` will access invalid memory.

data.title: Fix scheduler callback target lost issue
data.body:
https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/15769 wasn't the effective fix, problem is finally solved in this commit.

The core reason is JSScheduleWrapper is released right after unschedule call, then its callback reference is lost. The problem occurs when a frame took longer than schedule interval, then the scheduleFunc will be triggered multiply times, but if it's unscheduled during the first time, the following invocation will crash the game.
